results.title: T Pyxidis
results.creator_credit: Melanie Steptoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Melanie Steptoe recounts the story of T Pyxidis, a star. Sensing the wonders of the universe, T Pyxidis takes a bold step and initiates a journey to the Earth.

results.title: T is for Tumbleweed
results.creator_credit: Louis Clyde Stoumen, James A. Lebenthal and Camera Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: Portrays without commentary the racing, creeping, leaping travels of a tumbleweed and the encounters it has with people, animals and things. Photographed by Haskell Wexler.

results.title: T for teacher
results.brief_description: A cartoon all about a cup of tea, telling in amusing rhymes and sketches, how not to make a cup of tea, and some simple rules for making a good “cuppa”.

results.title: T-Rex: Back to the Cretaceous
results.brief_description: Ally Hayden shares her father’s interest in dinosaurs and archaeology. When he brings a mysterious fossil home, she’s convinced it’s a T-rex egg and isn’t wrong. When it breaks open she’s has visions of the Cretaceous period.

constellations_other.name: Big screen dreams
constellations_other.description: With groundbreaking technology and a unique cinema experience, today IMAX theatres are not only loved by audiences but championed by pioneering filmmakers like Christopher Nolan and James Cameron. Yet the route to get there was an unconventional one.

results.description: Ally Hayden is a teenager who shares her father’s interest in dinosaurs and archaeology. When he brings a mysterious fossil back from a dig, she is convinced it’s the egg of a Tyrannosaurus Rex. After accidentally knocking the egg to the floor, Ally begins to experience visions, as if she was being transported back in time to the Cretaceous period. There, she encounters several different dinosaurs, including her favorite, the mighty T-Rex.
description_for_label: Ally Hayden is a teenager who shares her father’s interest in dinosaurs and archaeology. There, she encounters several different dinosaurs, including her favorite, the mighty T-Rex.

results.title: T-Minus 4 years, 9 months, 30 days
results.creator_credit: Joel Banow, Robert Vitarelli, Ben Hill, Arthur Kane, William Crawford, David Buksbaum and CBS News
results.brief_description: Interviewer Walter Cronkite speaks to John Glenn about Saturn booster rockets and Dr Von Braun on the fuel and engines in the rockets. John Glenn, using a scale model, shows how astronauts will make observations on the moon, return from its surface in the Lunar Module and rendezvous with the Command Module before returning to earth.

results.title: T'es grand et puis t'oublies = When you grow up, you'll forget
results.brief_description:
In 1965, Henri, a young orphan, is sent to holiday camp, very much against his wish to stay in town with his elder sister. His relationship with his camp mates proves disastrous as the rumours goes around that he is an orphan. In order to boost his popularity, Henri pretends that he is the son of famous Tour de France hero, Raymond Poulidor, and that he can obtain autographs for everybody.

Credits: Producer, Denis Mermet ; director, writer, Serge Moati ; photography, Gerard de Battista ; music, Pierre Jansen.
Cast: Romain Bouteille, Elizabeth Wiener, David Benassayag.

results.title: System 6: a fragile nest
results.creator_credit: Jeni Kendell, Michael Daley, Craig Collie, ABC-TV (Australia), Environmental Protection Authority, W A and CSIRO
results.brief_description: System 6 is the name given by the Environmental Protection Agency to the area around Perth. It includes the Darling Ranges and the Swan River System. The detrimental effect of the urban sprawl and industrialisation in the karri forests, on sand dunes, and under the sea, is examined. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Syrinx
results.brief_description: She was the nymph who found refuge in the river reeds when the goat-god Pan pursued her. Syrinx is the first film of Ryan Larkin, a young artist from Norman McLaren’s student group. To illustrate the ancient Greek legend of how Pan made his pipes, he employs various charcoal sketches. Accompanying music is Claude Debussy’s Syrinx for solo flute. (Awards: Addis Ababa, San Francisco, Montreal, Philadelphia)
